headline.main: All Suicide Bombers Are Not Alike

lead_paragraph: Lelyveld's article makes the case for restricting the civil liberties of certain groups hiding in our open society far more eloquently than he himself may find comfortable. The resentment that makes terror possible may be born in repressive, failed societies in the Mideast, but it is only in our free society that it has an easy outlet or, indeed, a target worth striking. If we need to steel ourselves to do what we find repulsive, we should recall that Abraham Lincoln suspended habeas corpus during the Civil War and then give the Mossad a call. Chris Wyser-Pratte New Paltz, N.Y.
abstract: Chris Wyser-Pratte letter on argument that fight against terrorism may rquire restricting civil liberties of certain groups hiding in our open society (Oct 28 article by Joseph Lelyveld)
